result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A Barker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert A Barker in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-119 and 15CF-211.

10:32 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
15CF-119 Defendant will plead to Count 1. 
Count 2 would be dismissed.
Defendant will plead to Count 3.

15CF-211 This case will be dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes.

Atty Dalkert addresses the Court regarding post trial supervision program, was not on the table due to being a felony case.
Atty Dalkert concurs but is free to argue regarding conditional jail time, requests 6 months.


Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST Count 1 15CF-119
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3 15CF-119

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Dalkert for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-119: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein OWI 4th
15CF-119: Count 2: Dismissed
15CF-119: Count 3: Contrary to the statute section stated therein OAR
15CF-211: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Dalkert makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-119:
Count 1:
Prison Sentence for 3 Years
Initial confinement for 1 Year 6 Months
Extended supervision for 1 Year 6 Months
Eligible for challenge incarceration and earned release after 10 months
Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $1,200 plus costs totaling $2,452 approximately (close)
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
DOT assessment  BAC: .174  and comply with driver safety plan
IID for 35 Months
DL Revocation for 35 Months
Jail sentence for a period of 200 Days
Report today to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Continue on the pretrial supervision program until the jail sentence begins
Huber granted for work, employment and any counseling Defendant may be involved in
100 days may be on GPS unit
2 Days Jail Credit against the 200 days ordered
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations unless the department is willing to accept the recommendations from the DOT assessment
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and controlled substances
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
All precriptions are to be filled from one pharmacy
Sign all releases for the agent
Engage in any  other counseling as recommended by the agent
Maintain full time employment or full time schooling or a combination to equal full time
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment

Count 3:
Pay a fine of $100 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

Cash bond posted is to be applied to fine/costs.
Written explanation of determinate sentence is filled out.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert A Barker
Current: W13186 Archer Ave, Plainfield, WI 54966-9216 United States  (Effective: 11-17-2015)
Prior: 1782 Evergreen Ct, Custer, WI 54423
Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report - original filed in 15CF119
Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report - original filed in 15CF211
Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report - original filed in 15CF119
Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report - original filed in 15CF119

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Robert A Barker in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Atty Dalkert files a written Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert A Barker
Current: 1782 Evergreen Ct, Custer, WI 54423   (Effective: 06-22-2015)
Prior: 1782 Evergreen Ct 4, Custer, WI 54423

DA Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: 6/22/15   @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
